intro: Scadoxus cyrtanthiflorus, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a striking bulbous plant native to South Africa. It features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple, often with a distinctive red or orange stripe. The plant produces a tall, leafless stem that bears a cluster of blooms, making it a popular ornamental in gardens. Its bulbs are adapted to survive dry periods, allowing it to thrive in Mediterranean climates. It is typically grown in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
